Type.Name: TypeInitializationException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable TypeInitializationException extends System.SystemException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that occurs when an exception is thrown inside the static constructor of a type.

remarks.para: When a static constructor fails to initialize a type, a instance is created and passed a reference to the exception thrown by the static constructor. The property stores the exception that was thrown by the static constructor.

example.para: The following example demonstrates an error that causes a exception.
example.code: Error: System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for "TypeInit" threw an exception. ---> System.ApplicationException: Error in Class TypeInit at TypeInit..cctor() --- End of inner exception stack trace --- at TypeInit..ctor() at TestTypeInit.Main()

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
.property string TypeName { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_TypeName() }

summary.para: Gets the fully qualified name of the type that causes the exception.

value.para: A that contains the fully qualified name of the type that caused the exception.

remarks.para: The property returns the same value as was passed into the constructor.
